comment.author: 42432288@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Beautiful Vintage Memory, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 8598672@N06
comment._content:
*brambly*, the meaning is more like 'Nani who gathers the wood'. Nani would have been her name, (possibly a diminutive of Nansi or similar), rather than a word for grandmother. The Welsh for grandmother is Mam-gu (south) or Nain (north).

What a great photo, full of character.

comment.author: 82967752@N00
comment._content:
I love this whole series of portraits of women. There's a thread of steel running through all of them.

And, yes, I do know "Nain" is grandmother, now I come to think of it
